info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:40PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Mesa County through 430 PM MDT... At 340 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Fruita, or 13 miles west of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 16 and 17. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 39. Colorado 141 near mile marker 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
